ÃƒÅ¾Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Chemissian is an analyzing tool of molecules                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             electronic structure and spectra. It can manipulate              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             molecular orbital energy-level diagrams                          Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             (Hartree-Fock and Kohn-Sham orbitals), calculated                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             and experimental UV-VIS electronic spectra,                      Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             electronic/spin density maps and prepare them for                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             publication. Chemissian has a user-friendly                      Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             graphical interface and lets you examine and                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             visualize data from the output of Gaussian,                      Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             US-Gamess, Firefly/PC-Gamess quantum chemical                    Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             program packages. Chemissian tools helps you to                  Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             investigate nature of transitions in UV-vis spectra,             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             bonding nature, etc.                                             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Chemissian Features:                                             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Build Molecular Orbitals energy level diagrams                 Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Due to the integrated graphical editor it is easy to             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             add text labels to the diagrams, make connector                  Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             lines between MO energy levels, text labels, occupy              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             the energy levels with the electrons.                            Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             You can analyze the electronic structure of                      Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             molecules: you can move between energy levels simply             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             using the keyboard cursor buttons and in a useful                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             way obtain information about contributions to the                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             current molecular orbital from atoms or molecular                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             fragments and present the data in the most useful                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             and demonstrative way: on the contribution diagram               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             or directly on the MOs themselves.                               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Build, visualize and interpret UV-Visible Spectra              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º               from Gamess, Firefly and Gaussian outputs                      Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Chemissian with its exciting and unsurpassed                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             graphical analyzer of properties and composition of              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             MOs, has the wide range of capabilities for analysis             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             of electronic spectra of molecules. Chemissian offer             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             tools for building electronic UV/VIS spectra                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             directly from quantum-chemical data from GAMESS,                 Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Firefly(PC-GAMESS) or GAUSSIAN output files.                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Analyze electronic density distribution                        Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Using Chemissian you can analyze electronic and spin             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             density distribution, difference (also called                    Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             "defomation") density, individual molecular orbital,             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             and arbitrary linear combination of them (e.g. for               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             plotting Fukui functions).                                       Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Chemissian can build the distributions as                        Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             two-dimensional contour maps or build distribution               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             along the given line (one-dimensional). To build                 Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             densities only standart gamess/Firefly/gaussian                  Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             output file is used, e.g. no cube-files are needed.              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Calculate populations and valences                             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Chemissian can calculate Mulliken and Simple                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             populations of AOs, Shells, "Spherical Harmonics",               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Atoms or molecular fragments (any group of atoms).               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Also you can choose to calculate valences of AOs,                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Shells,"Spherical Harmonics", Atoms and fragments.               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Analyze molecular orbital composition - calculate                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             contributions from atomic orbitals, atoms, molecular             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             fragments, shells, etc. to the MOs.                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Calculate quantum-chemical bond order indexes and              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º               overlap populations                                            Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Use Chemissian to investigate bonding nature in the              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             molecules - calculate quantum-chemical bond order                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             indexes and overlap populations for every bond in                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             molecule. You can also analyze "generalized bond,                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             e.g. "bond" between molecular fragments.                         Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Work with several calculations at the same time                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             In a single document accumulate and analyze results              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             of several calculations, e.g. load several                       Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             GAMESS/Firefly/Gaussian ouput files. Simple example:             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             having you the source reagents and the final                     Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             reaction product you want to understand the changes              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             that have occurred on the electronic structure level             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             - you may add several calculations (reagent and                  Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             product) at the same diagram, and they will be                   Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             presented in the common energy scale, you can switch             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             between different calculations, compare and analyze              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             electronic structures all the participants at the                Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             same time.                                                       Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º                                                                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             * Save the results in a single file                              Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             Save the obtained document in a special file format,             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             which allows to keep all data in a single compressed             Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             file (uncompressed wave function takes up a lot of               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             disk space!); at any time you will be able to open               Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             and continue working with the saved document,                    Ãƒâ€º
Ãƒâ€º             analyze, edit the data, send it to your colleagues.              Ãƒâ€º
